name: Routing Protocols
description: Sub-sector template for routing protocol patents (CPC H04L45*) including BGP, OSPF, MPLS, and segment routing.
contextDescription: Routing protocol patents cover path selection and forwarding decisions. Key areas include BGP (internet backbone), OSPF/IS-IS (enterprise/SP), MPLS (carrier), and segment routing. High-value targets include Cisco, Juniper, Arista, Nokia, and cloud providers running their own routing stacks. Routing is fundamental to all IP networks.
scoringGuidance: BGP patents are essential for internet and data center routing.
Segment routing (SR/SRv6) patents target network modernization.
Fast reroute patents improve network resilience.
SDN routing patents enable programmable networks.
